website_summaries.verdict: It's spacious, fast, and good-looking – all for a low price. Choose it if you want the best value.
pros: Surprisingly affordable considering all it has to offer – 1,500 watts of power, cordless base that rotates, and sleek stainless steel design to name a few
cons: The lid doesn't always close tightly or feel very durable
A little noisy when heating up

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware!
customer_reviews.text: Everything started off great with this kettle until it died after less than 6 months. It appears the bottom of the kettle fried?Really?! Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: NMarshall

customer_reviews.title: I bought it in June last year, and it ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought it in June last year, and it broke down today. It worked well only for 9 months. It seems that the temperature sensor isn't working. It can't heat up the water - it switches to off mode a few seconds I pressed it "on". My husband asked me to get another electric kettle quickly. I dared not to buy this one again - I have to look for something else.
customer_reviews.author: Charissa Wong

customer_reviews.title: It got progressively worse and then I realized water was leaking out of ...
customer_reviews.text: Shortly after first using kettle I noticed water on the base (heating element) and couldn't figure out where it was coming from. It got progressively worse and then I realized water was leaking out of the plastic water level indicator window on one side of the kettle. It stopped leaking after the water was heated (thank God or it could have been dangerous) but I have requested a replacement unit. Will revise review after receiving the replacement kettle.
customer_reviews.author: Eliana

customer_reviews.title: Writing this review after having it for a year. ...
customer_reviews.text: Writing this review after having it for a year. It still works as well a year later as on day 1. Make sure to read the instructions since there is a minimal-fill level to reach so you don't fry the machine. Never have had weird-tasting tea or water, just really quick results! Would buy it again, but it seems so well build I might not need to!
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Love the way it works: will it last?????
customer_reviews.text: Even though I've only used this 6 times (heating water only!) since I received it less than a month ago, it has corrosion spots on the inside base. I love the way it works, but I'm afraid it won't last very long without rust and even more corrosion. Hopefully I'm wrong: we'll see.
customer_reviews.author: cheech

customer_reviews.title: Just got this today but I think it has been ...
customer_reviews.text: Just got this today but I think it has been used, just by opening the box I could feel this wasn't new. There is a mineral deposit on the spout and the box was sealed with scotch tape. I'm going to return it because I think I paid too much for something used.
customer_reviews.author: Marlin

customer_reviews.title: Itworks fine. I like the light indicator
customer_reviews.text: I received my kettle today. Tested for boiling water. It works fine.I like the light indicator, the top button for opening the kettle to fill water and the fact that it turns itself off when the water has boiled.I only wish it could keep the water warm for a longer period. And I thought it took long to boil.It takes about 5 minutes to bring to a rolling boil. I will be updating after using it for some time
customer_reviews.author: psdesy's

customer_reviews.title: Quality eroding over time.
customer_reviews.text: I have bought a number of these kettles over the years. At first, I was impressed. However, the quality has dropped and the most recent kettle did not even turn on, fresh out of the box. It was returned. The kettle model in past used to have a blue light that indicated "on" status; this recent one did not have that safety feature. The kettle lid will eventually stop opening properly, and that was true of every kettle. Because safety is the most important feature in such an item, and with the quality eroding, I no longer buy this item.
customer_reviews.author: terese

customer_reviews.title: Buy cheap pay twice
customer_reviews.text: If you have calcified water, don't use this thing. The seal between the bottom black piece and the metal is inferior and has now cracked and sprung a leak twice within the first 8 months of use. We had to pay $12 for shipping of the warrantied replacement from Hamilton Beach. You get what you pay for I guess, but seriously, if you have need for a daily kettle and your water is at all hard, get a better kettle.
customer_reviews.author: DrSativa

customer_reviews.title: takes forever to boil the water. longer than anything ...
customer_reviews.text: Update The kettle broke after few months of moderate use. I used this kettel for once or twice a day fur few months and is no longer working. ________________________________ takes forever to boil the water. longer than anything i have used before. a full kettle would take around 7-8 minutes to boil. it does however keep the water warm for some times (about 20 minutes in a warm day), Update. after only 6 weeks of moderate use, the kettle is now super loud and takes even longer to boil the water, a full kettle now takes about full 10 minutes to boil. This is a bad kettle that I will get ride of.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Leaking water
customer_reviews.text: Bought to replace the same one, which I was using more 10 years. The old one cannot close the lid anymore. After 3 weeks of using new one the water is leaking from the Water Level Window.
customer_reviews.author: Anna Konda

customer_reviews.title: Used Item Sold as NEW! Beware!
customer_reviews.text: Item is used. Out of box: Scratches on outside, bottom feet and inside already has rust spots forming.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Broken after ~3 years
customer_reviews.text: This was initially a nice, functional basic electric kettle. It seems like a mechanically simple device; all it does is heat water till it boils, then switch off. You'd think this could be engineered to last, but after about 3 years of use, the temperature-sensing switch has failed and the kettle now switches itself off at random in the middle of the cycle, no longer getting to a boil unless the switch is physically wedged into the on position. It wasn't built to last.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: About the only thing I liked about this product is the size
customer_reviews.text: About the only thing I liked about this product is the size. I'm not super intense about plastic, but the fact that the DOUBLE windows were long, covering a good portion of the pot AND that the plastic also jutted about 1/2" into the interior of the kettle (times 2!) was too much for me. I returned it and ordered the SECURA. Not one tiny bit of plastic comes in contact with the water/steam. While it is larger and heavier I am much happier with the product
customer_reviews.author: ColoradoGigi

customer_reviews.title: BUYER BEWARE- overheating danger
customer_reviews.text: This kettle worked fine for about the first three months I had it - I use it about 2-3 times a day to heat water for tea at work. Then out of nowhere it began to overheat - it gets dangerously hot to the touch and now I'm worried about it starting a fire or otherwise causing damage. I have contacted the manufacturer, but I will say I had a similarly negative experience with a Hamilton Beach blender that died after fewer than 10 uses. I should have known better before buying this, but I wanted it to work.
customer_reviews.author: euonymous

customer_reviews.title: Not easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: This electric water kettle functions fine, however, it is difficult to clean. I have used this product for over 1 year and this the second H. B. product where the inside of the container, in this product the kettle pot, the material flakes off. The deposits are not mineral build-up and I only use filtered water. I have other products that easily clean and remove mineral deposits with a vinegar + water solution. I am also going away from plastic products designed for food/drink, especially ones that are heated.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: sorry
customer_reviews.text: i know this had high reviews but i found it not to my liking. it boils water--slowly. the handle is not ergonomically shaped--the pot feels much to heavy at their angle. the on lever is small and you have to push it 'up' to turn on the pot--knocks the pot off the platform. the on light is very small. other than that it heats water and everything is OK.
customer_reviews.author: James Redpath

customer_reviews.title: Great on and off safety feature
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this tea pot. One of the BIG features is an on and off tab that cannot be accidently activated. Unlike most teapots where the on off tab pushes down for on this pushes up. That means when you set something down next to the teapot it will not be unknowingly activated thus melting or burning whatever is next to it. Holds ample amount and the space saving vertical size is also a plus. We have been very happy with this and would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: The Rev

customer_reviews.title: Good Value!
customer_reviews.text: Different from previous style of Hamilton Beach Tea Kettle. Old one had auto settings and temperature display. Good quality stainless steel kettle. Does not take up a lot of counter space. Not ecstatic of on/off switch design, don’t know yet if it will wear out. Has two windows to show water level. Nice feature!
customer_reviews.author: Moosekiss

customer_reviews.title: very happy i bought this one!  here's why:
customer_reviews.text: this is a very handy electric kettle. works perfectly, does everything i wanted it to do: 1. comes to a rolling boil before shutting off, 2. has a window to show me how much water i'm pouring into it, 3. holds sufficient water to heat up and then fill my teapot, and 4. the lid stays open without my having to hold it open so it's easy to pour water into it. can't think of anything else, but the point is, i'm totally all-round delighted with it.
customer_reviews.author: tessa

customer_reviews.title: Great product until it broke...
customer_reviews.text: I only use this once every couple weeks, so have not used it more than 20 times since i received it. Worked great...until I came into my kitchen to find water all over the counter/floor. The seal where the water level is measured failed and consistently leaked water over night. Thank god it was not next to my plugged in microwave or toaster, as that could have created a VERY dangerous situation. I would suggest going with a glass "measuring window" as opposed to plastic one like this one has. Wish the durability/quality was better because this worked well until it broke.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Schubert

customer_reviews.title: Nice electric tea kettle
customer_reviews.text: I had bought my wife an electric tea kettle to keep at her office. She brought it home over the Christmas holiday and I was amazed how well and quickly it heated up the water. I looked for the same model to order one for our home. Couldn’t find it so I settled for this model. It takes 6 minutes to boil a full pot which is quicker than a regular tea kettle on the stove. My only complaint is that it’s a bit noisy while it’s heating up and my counter vibrates a bit while it’s doing so. It does keep the water warm for a bit after it’s done.
customer_reviews.author: PFranco

customer_reviews.title: Great for a basic electric kettle
customer_reviews.text: Two things I missed in the description, so you don’t - there is no temperature control, on/off light, or beep when it’s heated. That being said, it’s a very nice basic kettle. It turns off when it’s boiling, and if you’re somewhere close by you can hear the power switch click off. If you want the water hot but not boiling (like me), just let it sit for a bit. Be careful, the outside gets hot. I use it at least once a day.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa Piskator

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality -- Don't Buy
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to replace a previous version -- what a mistake. The previous version was thick with calcium scale and we should have just used a quality cleaner to remove the scale. This one: 1) Doesn't always shut off when water boils - Dangerous if unattended 2) Top opens during boiling 3) Screen in spout does not stay securely fastened 4) Top opening is too small for access to clean 5) Strange positioning for on/off switch (down for on?) a push-button that pops out would be safer.
customer_reviews.author: M&J

customer_reviews.title: impossible to clean the inside
customer_reviews.text: This kettle works well electronically. However, the mouth is too small and so it is impossible to clean. The smallest hand will not fit through. The inside wall and bottom will remain forever soiled by mineral buildup from moderately hard water. I would advise not buying this if you ever want to clean the inside.
customer_reviews.author: Fred Mellender

customer_reviews.title: It took about four months for this to start happening and I am disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: This is a five star product that leaks... so its two stars in my book. Every morning I heat water. Some times I use all the water in the pot, some times there is some left over. The left over water leaks out of the pot. It took about four months for this to start happening and I am disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Phil Tatman

customer_reviews.title: Regular kettle. Not fast
customer_reviews.text: Just a regular electric kettle. Not fast - to boil full kettle you need 6 min 50 sec. Long enough power cord - 26 inches. Don't like that you need to push the power button UP (not down) to turn this kettle on. This button is very tight it's why is difficult to turn on the kettle with one hand - you need to hold it with another hand. Not a big deal, but together with boiling speed it takes too much time.
customer_reviews.author: GEV

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this so I could heat some water in the aftermath of a hurricane using my generator. It works well, but I wish I had splurged for a double wall kettle. The outside does get very hot. The spout pours water nicely, with no drips. A full kettle took about 5 minutes to boil. It is hard to fit a hand inside to wash out. Hopefully this isn't something I will need to use very often.
customer_reviews.author: SK

customer_reviews.title: A Better Kettle Than the Earlier Version
customer_reviews.text: By far better than their earlier version of this product. The old model had only one gauge located behind the handle. You couldn't see it very well. This new model has two gauges on the sides, making it easy to see. The top on the newer model also opens more fully, making it easier to fill. It's faster than putting a tea kettle on the stove and the automatic shut-off feature is effective and makes for a safer way to heat up water for your coffee in the morning.
customer_reviews.author: Major W

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I haven’t gotten to test out this new one yet, but I got the same kettle 2 years ago and it’s probably my favorite kitchen gadget to date. It’s not too loud, heats up quickly, and is so convenient. It sounds silly, but it’s been such a convenience to me. My roommate and I have used it pretty much every day, multiple times a day, for 2 yrs. so far no rust or mildew, and I’ve only had to rinse w/ soapy water and wipe it. It’s been great! Got this new one as a gift, will update once they try it out.
customer_reviews.author: Mich

customer_reviews.title: It started a 5 star and dropped to a 3 and headed to 1
customer_reviews.text: Kettle worked great at start then 90 days later it crashed. It will not heat the water. Sent an email to support and have not heard a work from them ( they say they will answer emails in 48 hours). After a week I called their phone number for support and it indicated a 45 minute wait for anyone. I then sent another problem report and so far its been 72 hours. Not holding much hope in hearing from anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Gene E. Autrey

customer_reviews.title: Defective! Power switch won't shut off. No response from manufacturer.
customer_reviews.text: This no-frills electric kettle worked fine at first. Then the anti-scale mesh filter broke off about a month after purchase (and after the return period had ended). That seemed like no big deal, but then the power switch stopped shutting off. In other words, the kettle heats up just fine, but once the water is at a rolling boil, it fails to shut off -- a clear safety hazard. I contacted Hamilton Beach but never received a response. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Boston Joe

customer_reviews.title: No auto-shutoff
customer_reviews.text: We bought this because our Aicock kettle broke after 3 years of frequent use. I thought Hamilton Beach was a better brand. This pot is as advertised; it boils water. But unlike our Aicock, it does not automatically shut off (keeping the water warm) when the water boils (often leaving the upper cabinets soaked in steam); the handle gets hot after it's been boiling because it didn't shut off; and you can't pick the temp (a minor point). I am considering ordering a better one and keeping this one for a back-up; we use it so often that this will annoy me every day.
customer_reviews.author: Virginia runner365

customer_reviews.title: I like it.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Hamilton-Beach Stainless Steel Electric Hot Pot. It does the job! I like it...goes with my kitchen décor. Some reviewers complained that it's noisy, and it is, but I don't stand there watching it...I leave the room, go about my business, and I come back and pour out my hot water. Keeps the water hot enough after I initially pour out my first cup so that I can also make a second cup of tea in the morning. Use it for breakfast, lunch, dinner, and for a bedtime cup of tea. I didn't give it five stars because it doesn't last years and years...only two or maybe three.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret Young

customer_reviews.title: Old Faithful
customer_reviews.text: I bought this one to replace we had for a little over 3 years. It has a simple, sleek design and gets the job done. I like the automatic shut off, and the mesh filter in the spout. I believe the first one we owned might have lasted another year or two, if not for my teenage son's heavy-handed style of returning the kettle to its base. He didn't yet know his own strength early on.
customer_reviews.author: Maura Alia Badji

customer_reviews.title: Meh, spend a little extra money for a better kettle.
customer_reviews.text: Fine kettle for price. I've had it for a couple months.. the switch to boil the water came upside down but it didnt bother me enough to return. The thing I notice is that the water never tastes quite right from this kettle. It honestly has always had an iron/metal like taste since day one and had gotten stronger with use. I dont leave water it in over night and I regularly try to let it dry completely. I dunno... I'll probably spend some extra money and buy one a little more high tech.
customer_reviews.author: Cait

customer_reviews.title: Got all rust inside the kettle after 1 month of use
customer_reviews.text: Its working fine for one month but after that water use to taste like iron rust. Then we saw it got all rust inside. After all washes rust is still there... Plz don't buy it...
customer_reviews.author: SHIVA

customer_reviews.title: They need to get a handle on this...
customer_reviews.text: Your basic no frills kettle. Some serious flaws though. The shape of the handle ensures the weight rests on your fingers not the palm of your hand. If you're not a professional arm wrestler I'd give it a pass. The second problem is the unit is an UN-insulated metal container. It gets hot on the outside and does not hold the heat well. It does heat water though.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Loved it the first eight months.  Still like it.
customer_reviews.text: This kettle is wonderful. It still works really great. Heats water up to boiling super fast . After owning over a year it still works just like the day it arrived. But, about eight months after purchase I started regularly finding water pooling around it. This only happened every once in awhile. I could never figure it out until today. It is getting worse so easier to find. It is leaking around the plastic fill level window. I am not sure if this can be sealed or if my wonderful still operating kettle is for the scrap heap. Very disappointed in this manufacture flaw.
customer_reviews.author: Creative6

customer_reviews.title: Economical, Dependable
customer_reviews.text: This is a basic economical electric kettle that has the features of many – auto shut-off when removed from base, and when water reaches boiling temperature. It also has a removable screen in the spout, to catch any chunks in your water, I guess. If you need English units of water volume, though, it does not have them; the units are metric only. It seems to heat water quite fast, and it meets my needs well, which is to have it with me while camping (where there is an outlet handy). The mouth of the kettle is a bit small, though; so you'll need someone with small hands to clean it if needed.
customer_reviews.author: ALAN

customer_reviews.title: DONT BUY!!!!
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY!!!!! This system had a short! Never got to use it even once. Customer service with Hamilton beach was a nightmare. I called and gave a callback number and they never called. Then I called the next day and waited over an hour for them to tell me I’d have to pay the shipping to replace the defective product. They were unwilling to follow through with limited warranty!!! ridiculously cheap company with faulty products and zero accountability
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Should not buy it
customer_reviews.text: I bought 3 at Costco. They always had same problems. After using 1 to 1.5 year, they leaked from bottom. And I bought fourth one on Amazon, this broke faster than Costco ones. Why I bought same one was because it was cheaper at Costco and on Amazon and I like its style. But I am so tired of this one, and today I bought an Aroma brand at Target. And lets see if my new one works better. The last thing I would say that Hamilton would not last 2 years.
customer_reviews.author: Soniya

customer_reviews.title: Very noisy
customer_reviews.text: I replaced an older Hamilton Beach electric kettle for this new one. It doesn't seem to be as well made. It seems more flimsy and is certainly a lot noisier when the water is heating.
customer_reviews.author: BGNorth

customer_reviews.title: Basic, solid, fast. It works. It's the budget choice of The Sweet Home.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this model on the strength of the recommendation from The Sweet Home, and what can I say? It's basic, it works. It would be nicer if it had a stainless lid, and didn't have the plastic window (I mean really, just look inside while you are filling it), and it was half the size. I don't need a litre and a half of boiling water for anything. I am a big believer in using cheaper, basic electric kitchen appliances, since none of them really last. I don't need eight different temperatures of water that aren't accurate, anyway. I just need boiled water.
customer_reviews.author: Midori Aoi

customer_reviews.title: Leaked after a few months
customer_reviews.text: Update: contacted the manufacturer (on their web site) and they sent me a new one fairly quickly. So, good customer service. We’ll see if this one last longer. It’s been a couple of months and so far so good. Original review:This kettle worked fine for a few months then started to leak from the bottom of the plastic water level Indicator as shown in pic
customer_reviews.author: Yaser Ibrahim

customer_reviews.title: Great kettle
customer_reviews.text: I love love love this pot. I immediately voided my warranty by dropping my tea bag into the kettle itself but I put it full and it gives me the exact strength of tea I want and enough tea for my day. I used to boil water and then steep in a separate pot. No longer necessary. I boil the water and let it sit for 4 minutes and the tea is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quick, Reliable, Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this kettle in September of 2017, and it is still running perfectly. I've filled the water past the top line before, and there was no spillage. When just heating up enough water for one cup of tea, it only takes about 2 minutes. The newer kettle models don't heat up on the outside as this one does, but it is a small price to pay for a reliable kettle. I highly recommend this model.
customer_reviews.author: Deanna Callerame

customer_reviews.title: Best hot pot
customer_reviews.text: I always have this type of hot pot and replace it immediately when the last one dies. So far this is my favorite. Hamilton Beach is always good quality, and I love the shape of this kettle. It is a cute, smallish looking design but still holds a lot of water. It heats up super fast.
customer_reviews.author: PK

customer_reviews.title: Boils fast and then shuts off reliably.
customer_reviews.text: This kettle boils water faster than my last one. It is easy to see how much water is in it because the gauge is on the side of the kettle instead of bring at the back, under the handle. So far the automatic switch-off has worked well. I am very happy with it, after about three weeks' use. My family had an electric kettle from the time I was seven yars old. (I am now ninety-five.) This was in England and I marvelled when I came to this gadget-minded continent, sixty years ago, that there were few electric kettles known then. Things have changed!
customer_reviews.author: Joy.

customer_reviews.title: One of the best purchases/most used in my kitchen.
customer_reviews.text: I was tired of boiling the water on the stove, and began looking into other options for tea/coffee. This came highly recommended from a friend so i bought it. It works great!! It is unbelievably easy to use, boils water very fast and the best feature is that it is safe to place on a counter or something after you boil because of how it is designed. It also is a very nice looking item in the kitchen. It works great, boils fast, and is absolutely worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Brian McLaughlin

customer_reviews.title: So far so good with this
customer_reviews.text: So far so good with this. I've had it for a weekend, have used it probably 4-5 times so far. Heats up water quickly, auto-shut-off seems to work, small footprint on my countertop. No complaints right now. It feels a little on the cheap side, like I'll be looking for a new one within a couple years, but this is the first one I've owned and I want to see how much use I get out of it before dropping much more money on one. For the price, I think it's a good deal.
customer_reviews.author: JLMTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Not good for a single cup, great for 2+ cups of hot beverage
customer_reviews.text: Boils water for my girlfriend and I quickly. Only downside is there is a minimum amount of water you can boil (0.5 Liters or ~17 oz/2 cups). So if you plan on buying this just to make yourself one cup of tea or coffee, this is not the best choice. Have been using for ~3 months and is still working well. The water where I live is a bit hard, and even though I filter my water, it will still leave calcium deposits on the bottom. To remedy this I just wash it with vinegar, or baking soda and water (whatever is more convenient) every other week which fixes the problem.
customer_reviews.author: Mitchell Lavarias

customer_reviews.title: Getting into Hot Water!
customer_reviews.text: What a neat way to heat water! I have exactly one cup of coffee every day. I grind the beans and do a pour-over with a Melitta filter holder. This beautiful appliance heats quickly, shuts off automatically, and is super easy to use for pouring into a cup for tea or pouring through a filter. There is another version that has a different location for the on-off switch and the fill viewer. I prefer this model. This is my second pot. Don't do what I did to my first pot. I absent-mindedly set it on the stove and turned on the ceramic burner. It melted in a very stinky way. That is not a fault of the appliance!
customer_reviews.author: Faith

customer_reviews.title: I wanted something that could heat up my water fast and at a good price. This does a fantastic job
customer_reviews.text: I first used one of these in London and although its not the same brand, I wanted something that could heat up my water fast and at a good price. This does a fantastic job! I've been using it for a few months now and haven't had any issues. Heats water in a few minutes and keeps it warm for a couple of hours thereafter. Great buy for me!
customer_reviews.author: KeKe9862

customer_reviews.title: Survived 2.5 years under heavy use
customer_reviews.text: The metal around the edges of the fill window corroded and it started to slowly leak. It got very frequent use and would have lasted longer if the pot were emptied of water roughly 5 minutes or so (for the filament to cool) after each use. I'd suggest not buying a kettle with a window like this if you don't empty it and you want it to last more than a few years. That said, I got more than $10 a year of value out of it, so I can hardly complain.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Stylish 1.5 L kettle
customer_reviews.text: After a long research, decided to get this one. I did not want the fancy lights in see-through kettles, cheap plastic ones, nor the too expensive ones. This Hamilton Beach has been a stylish and simple (in a good way) addition to our kitchen. Boils fast. Would order this again!
customer_reviews.author: Traveler

customer_reviews.title: Long Lasting
customer_reviews.text: I use my tea kettle maybe 10 times a day. This is the first tea pot I"ve had that lasted so long - it's now been 3-5 years since purchased my first Hamilton Beach.
customer_reviews.author: Ann

customer_reviews.title: Works great, heats quickly. Excellent product for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Love this kettle. Use it most days at the office and the only issue I’ve had is it will over work the circuit when we have heaters running as well. Must take a lot of energy to run, but heats water very quickly (just a couple minutes for a full pot) and stays hot for quite a while. It lets you know when the water has cooled because the switch will flip off. I highly recommend this and would buy it again. Great office kettle for tea or French press coffee!
customer_reviews.author: LanieCakes

customer_reviews.title: Hot Water in Seconds!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this after I ruined my stovetop kettle by leaving it on while I went out. Thankfully, I didn't burn down the house. Ever since I've been using this electric kettle and would never use anything else. I use it every day for coffee, but I've also filled it to capacity to pour hot water down the sink to unclog the drain. The water is heated to boiling in a matter of seconds! I've had it for almost two years now and it still works perfectly. I highly recommend this product - a must-have for those of us who can be forgetful when cooking.

customer_reviews.title: I bought this so my not so elderly wife will ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this so my not so elderly wife will no longer forget to turn the gas burner off under the tea kettle. The 40880 heats up quickly and gets just as hot as the old tea kettle. After about a month we noticed the boil was getting noisy. Equal amounts of white vinegar and water brought to a boil (twice) and a thorough rinsing solved that by eliminating the scale buildup on the bottom. I'd buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Fiend4Mojitos

customer_reviews.text: Only work for 4 months as it started to taste like metal recently and end up throwing it away. Not sure why it started to do that, I hope it was stainless steel as it stated. customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm!

customer_reviews.author: Marty

customer_reviews.title: Heats quickly
customer_reviews.text: I love this electric tea kettle. It heats quickly and keeps water hot for a while. It is easy to turn it back on to heat again if it gets cool. I don't have to worry about turning the stove top off each time as this pot turns itself off after coming to boiling.
customer_reviews.author: Julia L.Bones

customer_reviews.title: and I think 6 years is a pretty good life for such use
customer_reviews.text: This is the second kettle of this kind that I ordered - the first one started leaking after 6(!) years of every day use. I boil water at least 10 times a day for either baby formula, or tea & coffee, and I think 6 years is a pretty good life for such use. In all that time the kettle collected very little scum, and there is a mesh guard to protect you from anything that might get into your cup.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy Novak

customer_reviews.title: I love this thing

It feels weird rating such a simple tool 5 stars but I cannot possibly think of anything to take away or add to this excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: Nobody

customer_reviews.title: Quickest Hot Water
customer_reviews.text: This is the most amazing electric water kettle. I have been heating water using the tradition stove top water kettle and impatiently waiting for the "whistle" for years. This kettle heats up the 1.7 liters soooooooooo fast. No more waiting for the "whistle. If here is anything I'd change is would be have a little longer electrical cord, but I understand the safety issues with doing that. I wish I had not waited so long to get one. I was so impressed, that I purchased a second kettle for my office.

customer_reviews.title: Heats up fast

customer_reviews.author: Blossom

customer_reviews.text: I despise this. Who would think anyone would feel like that about a water heater? One - the button flips UP to turn it on. So, if it’s not completely full, you must use two hands or you’ll push it right over. I did twice. Two - There is no beep when it’s done. If you’re busy and not standing right with it, you miss it and have to reheat it. As small as those issues are, I hate this thing and feel like I need to go get one in person so I can literally see the switch, which should be pushed down to turn on. I drink too much tea all day for this.

customer_reviews.title: Good Affordable pot

customer_reviews.author: Nancy

Do not know what to do, as I bought awhile back but did not start to use until 30 days agi, Very disappointed and feel mislead by New York Times reviewer who said to buy this kettle. RE; ratings. I've been using it for several weeks now without any other complaints.

customer_reviews.author: gamerlove

customer_reviews.author: Diane Cullen

Very happy even after 6 months of use.
customer_reviews.author: dm

customer_reviews.title: Water Leaking Hazard
customer_reviews.text: The unit began leaking water from the plastic window level indicator onto the heating plate/cord after nine months of usage. However, due to the hazard this design flaw that the leaky plastic window presents, we have not requested a replacement. Hamilton Beach would be well-served to address this as it is not “safer that the stovetop” with this design flaw present.

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm

It is easy to fill, has an automatic shutoff, and heats up quickly. If there is any downside, it would be that the water is extremely hot and there is a potential to get seriously burned even just from the steam. I actually now don't wait until it has clicked off, I use it as soon as I hear it is getting hot and that seems to work well. I've had it about a year now and no problems at all.

customer_reviews.title: An inexpensive trustworthy electric kettle

Heats water in no time and it’s more useful than we thought. It boils water very fast; the handle also stayed cool after boiling, and the spout didn’t dribble when pouring. Totally recommend this product for someone looking for a basic kettle at a decent price point. Will update my review if anything changes in the future.

Overall, I am very pleased with the purchase.
